        public static void permissionsRequestShortcut(@NonNull
                                              android.app.Activity activity,
                                              @NonNull
                                              PermissionUtilities.permissionsEnum[] perms)
        Static shortcut to allow for quick calls if a recurring call is not needed NOTE! Does make the actual permissions request
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity in context
        perms - Permissions array being requested

      • permissionsRequestShortcutReturn

        public static boolean permissionsRequestShortcutReturn(@NonNull
                                                       android.app.Activity activity,
                                                       @NonNull
                                                       PermissionUtilities.permissionsEnum[] perms)
        Static shortcut to allow for quick calls if a recurring call is not needed. It also returns a boolean if the perms have already been granted. This is a hybrid call of the Shortcut request above and the check granted permissions call below. NOTE! Does make the actual permissions request
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity in context
        perms - Permissions array being requested

      • checkGrantedPermissions

        public static boolean checkGrantedPermissions(@NonNull
                                              android.app.Activity activity,
                                              @NonNull
                                              PermissionUtilities.permissionsEnum[] perms)
        Static shortcut to allow for quick calls to check if perms were granted. NOTE! Does NOT make the actual permissions request
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity in context
        perms - Permissions array being requested

      • startPermissionsRequest

        public boolean startPermissionsRequest(@NonNull
                                       PermissionUtilities.permissionsEnum whichPerm)
        Overloaded method to allow for one permissions
        Parameters:
        whichPerm - single permission to request
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean, true if all permissions are set to true, false if not

      • startPermissionsRequest

        public boolean startPermissionsRequest(@NonNull
                                       PermissionUtilities.permissionsEnum[] whichPerms)
        Request permissions
        Parameters:
        whichPerms - array of permissions to request. NOTE! If you send permissions which are not requested in the manifest, you will get a ANR error and the screen will freeze entirely, IE: ( Wrote stack traces to '/data/anr/traces.txt' ). This same error will be thrown if this is called in an activity before the view is set (setContentView()).
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean, true if all permissions are set to true, false if not

      • checkGrantedPermissions

        public boolean checkGrantedPermissions(@NonNull
                                       PermissionUtilities.permissionsEnum[] whichPerms)
        Class that checks if all the permissions passed in have been grated.
        Parameters:
        whichPerms - Which perms to check
        Returns:
        True if all have been granted, false if not

      • makeDialogForSettings

        public static void makeDialogForSettings(@NonNull

                                         PermissionUtilities.permissionsEnum[] perms)
        Makes a dialog popup where if the user clicks the affirmative it will take them to the settings of the phone so they can adjust the settings
